creator: Anton Balashov
descriptionHtml:
That's MathWammer :) The application simulates thousands of dice throws in tabletop games and shows analysis results in a convenient way. Suitable for Warhammer 40k.
Just set who will attack whom and you will see all useful analyses.
Helps to figure out:
1. Is there a chance to eliminate an enemy unit?
2. Should you take for your Knight thermal or battle cannon?
3. Which knight's house is better: with an additional attack of with +1 to hit?
And so on.
The app is in active development and features like rerolls will coming soon.
descriptionShort: Calculator suitable for Warhammer 40k. Simulates thousands of dice throws.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* The main: Modifiers like "-1 to hit", "halve damage" and so on were added for Targets.
* Improved UI.

title: 40k Calculator

creator: Anton Balashov
descriptionHtml:
The application simulates thousands of dice throws in tabletop games and shows the ananytic in a convenient way. Suitable for Warhammer 40k 9th Edition.
Just set who will attack whom and you will see useful analyses.
Key features:
1. Several weapons for each attacker can be added.
2. Complex parameters like 3D + 3 and not only for Damage but for S, A, AP.
3. Support modifiers like re-rolls, -1 to hit, -1 to damage, and so on.
4. Draw damage distribution charts.
5. Several attackers for comparison.

Examples of use:
1. Is there a chance to eliminate an enemy unit?
2. Should you take for your Knight thermal or battle cannon?
3. Which knight's house is better: with an additional attack of with +1 to hit?
And so on.

The app is in active development and new features are coming!
descriptionShort: Calculator suitable for Warhammer 40k. Simulates thousands of dice throws.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* The main: first modifications for weapons have been added.
* Counting of mortal wounds is fixed.
* Now analytics doesn't score exceed damage.
* Fixed a few UI defects.

descriptionShort: Calculator suitable for Warhammer 40k. Simulates thousands of dice throws.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Trial period is added to try the full version
* Attacker now can be copied to easily compare weapons for it.
* New type of mods roll additional dice and discard the lower result
* Improved UI logic

descriptionShort: Calculator suitable for Warhammer 40k. Simulates thousands of dice throws.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* The main: added catalog to save attackers and load them later.
* Added new mods: poisoned weapons, auto-wounds on 5+, 6+ toHit, AP-4 on 6+ to wound.
* Max T is changed to 10.

descriptionShort: Calculator suitable for Warhammer 40k. Simulates thousands of dice throws.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
New mods:
* Wound roll of 6: 1,2,3 mortal wounds instead;
* Wound roll of 6: add 3 mortal wounds
* Skip wound roll on 5,6 to hit
* HIT_PLUS_1
* WOUND_PLUS_1

title: MathHammer 40k

creator: Anton Balashov
descriptionHtml:
The application simulates thousands of dice throws in Warhammer 40000 9th Edition and shows the analytic in a convenient way.
Just set who will attack whom and you will see the detailed analysis.
Key features:
1. Several weapons for each attacker can be added.
2. Complex parameters like 3D + 3 and not only for Damage but for S, A, AP.
3. Supports a ton of modifiers like re-rolls, -1 to hit, -1 to damage, and so on.
4. Draw damage distribution charts.
5. Several attackers for comparison.

Examples of use:
1. Which unit should I buy/take next?
1. Is there a chance to eliminate an enemy unit?
2. Should you take for a Knight thermal or battle cannon?
3. Which knight's house is better: with an additional attack of with +1 to hit?
And so on.

Development is based on your feedback and ideas, so, stay in touch and we will build something great together :)
descriptionShort: Attack calculator for Warhammer 40k 9th. Choose strongest units for your roster

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
The main: now it's possible to back up your catalog, send it and load it on another device!
New modifiers:
* On D6 attacks: minimal 3 (blast rule).
* On D6 attacks: re-roll 1,2.
* Improved app stability.
